text: bursting cherry tomatoes and hot oil
brings out their sweetness so this is
the perfect pasta to make on the fringes
of tomato season I'm gonna add my
pancetta you need just a little bit of
oil so that doesn't stick if you have a
choice in pancetta try to find the thick
cut slices rather than they're really
thin ones they just add better texture
to the pasta once the pancetta starts to
get a little bit Brown around the edges
and it looks all glistening it's gonna
throw in my garlic cloves that I had
smashed and peeled I'm gonna leave them
whole so they get sweet fresh red pepper
flakes and a nice big pinch of salt then
when the garlic starts to get a little
bit Brown but not too Brown you add your
cherry tomatoes which are halved that
gives it more surface area this is gonna
need about five minutes to cook down
what you're doing is evaporating all
those tomato juices and condensing them
it gets very intense almost jammy so
while the tomatoes are cooking you
should have your pot pasta going get
your pasta and your tomatoes to finish
it about the same time and when you
drain your pasta save some of the pasta
cooking water it's gonna help make a
sauce so this is what I'm looking for
the tomatoes they are not bossy they're
just a little bit soft
I have Cecilia here because I like the
way that the little ridges catches all
of that good flavor of the sauce and the
pancetta you want to get this stirred
together really well I'm gonna add a
little pasta cooking water at this point
just because it's looking a little dry
and then butter olive oil pancetta and
butter this is a good pasta dish you
really want to take the time to get all
the pancetta bits well-distributed
otherwise one person gets all of them
and everybody else is mad at them and
that's it so I've got the basic pasta
I'm gonna put it in my dish and then I'm
gonna garnish it and the garnish you're
gonna see that's the seriously cool part
by the way vegetarians can just leave
out the pancetta maybe add a little bit
of pecorino instead to kind of make up
for that salty bite so in this bowl I've
got some ricotta cheese just fresh
ricotta you don't want to mix it in here
because you want that contrast between
super creamy and then savory salty sauce
and here's the cool garnish part
beautiful red scallions or you could use
regular scallions these are fresh
they're raw it's a whole other flavor
from cooked onion and it's really nice
with the today
fresh mint leaves I'm gonna tear these
up and put them all over the top by the
time this is done it's gonna look more
like salad the reason you want to tear
up your mint leaves instead of cutting
them is because the second you cut them
they start to turn brown and tearing
them just releases their oils just a
little bit of well just a few drops the
pepper a little bit of flaky salt so
this really is almost like a salad and
that's what makes it so summery is the
fresh mint leaves and the scallions and
then you get something bright and lively
and also something cooked and rich in
every single bite
Oh
